Dialogue: NULL
Full Clue: NULL

Dialogue: You...You fell from the sky!~How is that possible?~Am I dreaming?
Full Clue: Gi...gi naltaao nimu!

Dialogue: You are hurt, but no one can help you this far from the tower...~Tower, do you understand?~Go to the tower!
Full Clue: I debluao, tap gi chiwech ikuuw mashsas

Dialogue: Someone in the village must be able to heal you with their magic~Head in the tower's direction.~You'll reach the village~...hopefully.
Full Clue: Nudebe tapech liichaade gi kaatoch ko mashsuasi

Dialogue: I heard the tower has magic that can do anything...~I've never been that close before, but if the stories are true...
Full Clue: Piiwime aheepimu ko mashsuasi ikaw mashsas

Dialogue: Do you know the story about the man in the tower?~A bard told me about it a long time ago.~I can barely remember the detail...
Full Clue: Authedao hajieen kaata vi mashsas?

Dialogue: Oh, good, you are okay. If only I could help my daughter with this medicine.~She’s gravely ill but can’t get better without proper food.
Full Clue: oh drong, tad hyidt'eh. Tsad lij g’om liji dfak frabang wite dfog’a.
Flag1 Dialogue: Is this… a stone of the tower?~If it really is, my daughter is saved! Thank you so much, traveler.~I wish you luck in your journey, wherever it may lead.

Dialogue: We must not rely on magic to solve our problems.~Through faith and diligence, we will be able to restore the crops.~Those who are reliant on magic will not know how to reap God’s rewards.
Full Clue: Muju dro'fraban ti winei adui'ipuu!
Flag1 Dialogue: A group of bandits live nearby, on the other side of the village. Please find out if they have anything to do with the crops being destroyed.
Flag2 Dialogue: This stone is incredibly dangerous!~In order to keep it out of the wrong hands, I will be destroying it.~Thank you for delivering it to me.

Dialogue: The stone must be somewhere in that village! Go find it!~We’ve already dug up the crops and it wasn’t in the soil! I will not hesitate to turn the whole village upside down if it means I can find the stone!
Full Clue: Iiloaa ninoowii yolee pazii siwoofe! Wu chiwee!
Flag1 Dialogue: My daughter… my daughter!~With this stone, my daughter can live! The search was not in vain!

Dialogue: You, strange traveler! Good timing!~Take this shovel. We’ve looked everywhere and we can’t find the stone.
Full Clue: Ma! K'ipuu lomoo! Chiike chaa rore!

Dialogue: I met a really good storyteller in that village before
Full Clue: Pii pa zofuu chiike maari'uui siwoofe

Dialogue: I think boss must be crazy. The story of that stone is too good to be true.
Full Clue: T'uui ninoowii n'jiuu pii kuuroo. Maari fa iiloaa ryu chiike.

Dialogue: Boss, I think this traveler comes from somewhere really far.
Full Clue: T'uui, yaa zo k'ipuu pii kuuroo yolee'vumu.

Dialogue: What does boss want to do with that stone?
Full Clue: Wii tʼuui niva lu te'aa iiloaa ?

Dialogue: Traveler, have you heard the story about a stone that glows?
Full Clue: Kʼipuu, puu ma vaapii maari fa sima iiloaa

Dialogue: … The village was known for their plentiful corn harvest, among other crops...
Full Clue: ...Nlad liko gorfi tsah hyi glang tsagi, b’im ibeg’d...

Dialogue: I know Daddy can help me get better.
Full Clue: Lji gorfi kpapa g'om dfak'miiaro.

Dialogue: Can you get some corn for my daughter?
Full Clue: G'om fi'ktad glang kstar frabang?

Dialogue: ... No one knew how it was destroyed...~Debris from the tower was scattered throughout many villages. ...
Full Clue: ...jik dag gorfi kig tsats gok b’ok heddim...

Dialogue: Some believed magic to be the root of their success, as stories of a powerful stone were passed down through generations.
The corn… it’s all destoryed!
Full Clue: d...dfak...gorfi kalta!

Dialogue: Why would someone dig up our crops like this?
Full Clue: Th'ar gorfi co'ktad dfak yem....

Dialogue: Is it destroyed because of that legend? The one about the stone?
Full Clue: E'ar gorfi kig yom chy'ko? Pet'sa bogh quemasus?

Dialogue: How can we grow the corn without the stone?
Full Clue: Pu'ar rhish'miia glang ityh'na quemasus?
